heading: Are Bagels gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Bagels and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Traditional bagels are typically made from wheat flour, which contains gluten, posing a risk for individuals with coeliac disease. However, gluten-free bagels are available, but cross-contamination can occur during preparation.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Bagels can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

faq.question: Can BiteRight confirm if Bagels are gluten free?
faq.answer: BiteRight highlights likely gluten risks based on ingredients and preparation. Always confirm with the kitchen if you have coeliac disease.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
faq.answer: Ask about shared equipment, toasters, and whether they have certified gluten-free bagels.
